rawValue: The purchase of the kinds of insurance prescribed in this article is not required in order to secure the loan or an extension of credit.

source.extractedValue: The purchase of the kinds of insurance prescribed in this article is not required in order to secure the loan or an extension of credit.

context.surroundingText: Credit insurance agents must provide four mandatory disclosures under Insurance Code Section 1758.97(b)
context.pageTitle: California Credit Insurance Agent Required Disclosures

rawValue: The insurance coverage offered by the credit insurance agent may provide a duplication of coverage already provided by a purchaser's other personal insurance policies or by another source of coverage.

source.elementRef: Required Disclosures section - 2. Potential Coverage Overlap
source.extractedValue: The insurance coverage offered by the credit insurance agent may provide a duplication of coverage already provided by a purchaser's other personal insurance policies or by another source of coverage.

context.surroundingText: Credit insurance agents must provide four mandatory disclosures under Insurance Code Section 1758.97(b)

rawValue: The endorsee is not qualified or authorized to evaluate the adequacy of the purchaser's existing coverages, unless the individual is licensed pursuant to Article 3 (commencing with Section 1631).

source.elementRef: Required Disclosures section - 3. Endorsee Qualification Limitation

source.elementRef: Required Disclosures section - 4. Cancellation Rights with Refund Terms
source.extractedValue: If the customer cancels within 30 days from the delivery of the insurance policy, certificate, or notice of proposed insurance, the premium will be refunded in full.

context.surroundingText: The customer may cancel the insurance at any time. If the customer cancels within 30 days from the delivery of the insurance policy, certificate, or notice of proposed insurance, the premium will be refunded in full.
context.pageTitle: California Credit Insurance Agent Required Disclosures

rawValue: any unearned premium will be refunded in accordance with applicable law

source.elementRef: Required Disclosures section - 4. Cancellation Rights with Refund Terms
source.extractedValue: If the customer cancels at any time thereafter, any unearned premium will be refunded in accordance with applicable law.

context.surroundingText: If the customer cancels at any time thereafter, any unearned premium will be refunded in accordance with applicable law.

source.elementRef: Key Requirements section - Bodily injury liability

context.surroundingText: California law mandates that drivers carry minimum auto insurance coverage: Bodily injury liability coverage of $15,000 per person/$30,000 per accident minimum

source.extractedValue: Insurance carriers must make a "prompt written inquiry" to their insured policyholder asking permission before disclosing policy limits information to third-party claimants before litigation begins.
